bibl.title: Towards an Explanation of the Typology of the So-Called "Orders to Arrest".
bibl.note: The use of the term "Orders to Arrest": a historical overview. - Changes in administration and language of the orders. - Notes on the typology of the "Orders to Arrest". - 1. P. Mich. Inv. 236. Order to the archephodos of Psobthis. Oxyrhynchite nome, II A.D. - 2. P. Mich. Inv. 5493b verso. Order from the proestotes (?) to the eirenarch of Karanis. Karanis, IV A.D.; - recto. List of êpora ÙnÒmata. Karanis, IV A.D. - 3. P. Mich. Inv. 5298b. Order to the kephalaiotes of the eirenarchs. Karanis, first half of IV A.D. - Addenda to the consolidated list [published by: Adam BÜLOW-JACOBSEN, Orders to Arrest. P. Haun. inv. 33 and 54 and a Consolidated List, ZPE 66 (1986) pp. 95-98.] - Excursus. The instances of érgale(›)ow and §rgale(›)ow in papyri from the Ptolemaic to the early Islamic period. <apora onomata, argaleios, argaleos, ergaleios, ergaleos>
GAGOS Traianos and P.J. SIJPESTEIJN †, Towards an Explanation of the Typology of the So-Called "Orders to Arrest".
